result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Leondre Durrah in court.  Attorney Micaheal Moran for  Michael G. Levine in court for Leondre Durrah.  Attorney Jacob Corr for Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests motion for severance hearing. Court orders State reply by 11-16-2022. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Leondre Durrah in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Leondre Durrah.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-22-2022, filed.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO SEVER DEFENDANTS.

Defendant Leondre Durrah in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status/scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

08/06/2022

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Leondre Durrah not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael K. Moran in court, defendant Leondre Durrah not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a status conference date for additonal time for negotiations. Court granted defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Leondre Durrah not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard. Court orders $5000.00 cash bail and all previously ordered conditions of bail remain. Defense request additional time for review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Branch 4 down. Parties contacted to reschedule. Defense requesting bail hearing. Parties agree upon next court date. Parties notified. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail

Defendant Leondre Durrah in court with Attorney Michael Moran on behalf of Attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant Leondre Durrah in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Saavedra. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with X.S.H., J.X.M. III, C.B.W.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Leondre Durrah in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Leondre Durrah in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
